24902030.trustfund:
TF093142-ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES FOR
            YOUNG PEOPLE IN COLOMBIA (BANK-EXECUTED),TF091174-INSTITUTIONAL AND COMMUNITY
            STRENGTHENING FOR LOCAL GOVERNANCE AND DEVE,TF091175-INSTITUTIONAL AND COMMUNITY
            STRENGTHENING FOR LOCAL GOVERNANCE AND DEVE,TF057592-JSDF: SEED -  RESULTS-ORIENTED
            LOCAL AND INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDIN,TF052530-PHRD-COLOMBIA: PEACE AND
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF025569-PHRD-CALI VIOLENCE CONTROL AND
            PREVENTION PROJECT,TF096627-Colombia: Strengthening Human
            Rights and Rights to Basic Social Service,TF095198-Gender and IDPs: Integrating
            Gender into Colombia Peace and Development,TF093141-Access to Opportunities for
            Young People in Colombia

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Peace and Development
            Project for Colombia were as follows outcomes were
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; bank
            performance was satisfactory; borrower performance was
            satisfactory. There are some of the key lessons learned from
            this project: (i) the Peace and Development Program (PDP)
            methodology is useful for generating development processes
            that are conducive to peace;(ii) interventions in areas of
            conflict, supported by alliances among the Government of
            Colombia (GOC), international community and civil society,
            generate greater legitimacy from the outset; (iii)
            consensus-building based on trust in the midst of contexts
            marked by violence and polarization, has the potential to
            influence local development processes;(iv) the Partner
            Organization (PO) profound knowledge of the territories,
            their knowledge of the socioeconomic and political dynamics,
            imprinted realism to the PDP interventions;(v) building on
            lessons from Learning and Innovation Loans (LIL) to scale up
            the program using an Adaptable Program Loan (APL) was
            particularly useful in supporting a long term peace and
            development agenda. Project development objective is assist
            vulnerable, low income and displaced populations in rural
            and urban communities located in conflict-affected regions,
            in order to reduce the risk of their exposure to conflict
            and mitigate the negative impact of possible derived effects.

repnme.cdata!:
Vision 3DH - Tool for development projects
            from the perspective of human rights : Vision 3DH -
            Herramienta para ver los proyectos de desarrollo desde la
            optica de los derechos humanos

abstracts.cdata!:
This paper on Vision 3DH is a tool for
            development projects from the perspective of human rights.
            It is a new way of conceiving development projects that
            improves dramatically its impact on the lives of those who
            participate in them. The 3DH Vision focuses on development
            efforts in the enjoyment of human rights. The Vision 3DH is
            specially designed for individuals and development agents
            who conceive, design, implement, evaluate and study
            development projects, to be interested in expanding impacts
            in the enjoyment of rights. It is also relevant for anyone
            interested to explore the meeting points between development
            disciplines and human rights. Development projects in their
            design or in the early stages of planning are those that
            will benefit from the implementation of the vision. However,
            initiatives already underway will also receive revenues from
            its implementation, especially since it can be incorporated
            to complement the advance work without altering the essence
            of each project.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Japan Social Development Fund
            (JSDF) Grant Access to Opportunities for Young People
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Japan Social
            Development Fund (JSDF) Grant Access to Opportunities for
            Young People Project is to enhance the access of young men
            and women, between the ages of 14 to 26 years old, to
            opportunities for education, work and political
            participation. The changes intend to transfer resources from
            category (5) sub-grants for subprojects to categories: (1)
            consultants' services, (2) training or workshops and
            (4) operating costs. It is important to mention that the
            proposed changes will not alter the objective, components,
            activities, or deliverables of the project; neither will
            they imply a change to the project's safeguards.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Japan Social Development Fund
            (JSDF) Grant Access to Opportunities for Young People
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Japan Social
            Development Fund (JSDF) Grant Access to Opportunities for
            Young People Project is to enhance the access of young men
            and women, between the ages of 14 to 26 years old, to
            opportunities for education, work and political
            participation in Colombia. The proposed changes are: (i)
            clarify that the activities related to part B.2 of the
            project will be performed through sub-grants; (ii) specify
            the funds allocated to said sub-grants; (iii) specify the
            number of events that will be carried out under Part B.1 of
            the project; (iv) remove part D of the project from of the
            grant agreement; and (v) other formal changes such as
            updating of the anti-corruption guidelines and correcting a
            few typos and missing words in the description of activities.
